elements.text:
The audio workspace is where you make music and
sound effects for your cartridges. Like the other
editor workspaces, there is a hamburger menu at
the top left and file tabs along the top of the
toolbar.

This workspace is split into three editors,
selected via buttons in the left column: an
Instrument editor, an SFX editor, and a Pattern
editor.

Per .sfx file, Picotron has 24 instrument slots,
128 SFX slots, and 64 pattern slots for making
sound effects and music. Clicking on an SFX or
pattern number will automatically open it in the
appropriate editor; clicking on an instrument
number will select it for SFX entry or editing,
but not change which editor is open.

As with PICO-8 and a number of DAWs, the computer
keyboard is mapped to piano keys for note entry.
This mapping is theoretically based on the
physical layout of the keyboard:

...but as of v0.1.0e, this is broken for some
users and the notes played are based on QWERTY
layout instead.
